Facilities

Hosts

University of Trento - Physics Department more_vert
University of Trento - Physics Department close

The University of Trento is a recent, medium-sized university: the Department of Physics was established in 2012 after its researchers had been engaged in many key sectors for almost 40 years. During this event the University will host talks focused on the research performed in Trento about Bose-Einstein condensation and Nanosciense

mapMap publicWebsite
Innsbruck Physics Research Center more_vert
Innsbruck Physics Research Center close

The Innsbruck Physics Research Center conducts many researches about a broad range of modern topics in physics. The Center is organized along three main research areas: Astro- and Astroparticle Physics, Ion- and Applied Physics, and Quantum Physics. The Center cooperates with many research institutions worldwide and provides a truly international environment for researchers from all over the world.

mapMap publicWebsite
IQOQI (Institute for Quantum Optics and Quantum Information) more_vert
IQOQI (Institute for Quantum Optics and Quantum Information) close

The Institute for Quantum Optics and Quantum Information (IQOQI) of the Austrian Academy of Sciences dedicates its work to theoretical and experimental basic research in the areas of quantum optics and quantum information science. Internationality, worldwide networking and highly actual research topics characterize the institute's work. A particular concern of the institute is the sustainable advancement of young academics, and together with the University of Innsbruck, their integration into the research and teaching program.

mapMap publicWebsite
FBK (Fondazione Bruno Kessler) more_vert
FBK (Fondazione Bruno Kessler) close

Fondazione Bruno Kessler is a research non-profit public interest entity. Just across the street from the Physics Department of Trento, it is ranked at the 1st place for scientific excellence within 3 different subject areas (ICT, History and Sociology) in Italy. During our event we will have the opportunity to visit this reserch center.

Q@TN
publicWebsite
Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica

The Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica (AISF) gathers together most of the Italian physics students. It was founded in Heidelberg in August 2014 and since January 2015 is a National Committee for the International Association of Physics Students (IAPS).
